alert.note: Alert for Adair; Cherokee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued December 21 at 3:30AM CST until December 23 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO 6 PM CST THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM THURSDAY TO NOON CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Dangerously cold wind chills expected Thursday into Thursday night behind an arctic cold front with wind chills 15 degrees below zero by Friday morning. For the Winter Weather Advisory, mixed precipitation will quickly transition to snow behind the front. Total snow accumulations generally 1 to 2 inches with light glaze initially possible. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Cherokee and Adair Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 4 AM to 6 PM CST Thursday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 6 AM Thursday to noon CST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact travel. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Near blizzard like conditions will briefly be possible behind the front with greatly reduced visibilities.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. For the latest road conditions call 1-844-465-4997 or go to okRoads.org.
